entry.title: Blizzard Warning issued January 08 at 2:58PM AKST until January 10 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...BLIZZARD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TUESDAY NIGHT TO NOON AKST WEDNESDAY FOR NUNIVAK ISLAND AND THE KUSKOKWIM DELTA COAST... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Visibility reduced to one quarter mile or less at times. Total snow accumulations of up to 4 inches. East to southeast winds gusting 25 to 40 mph. * WHERE...Nunivak Island and the Kuskokwim Delta Coast.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued January 08 at 12:50PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: A low pressure system moving northward into the Bering Sea Wednesday into Thursday will bring another round of strong winds, snow, and blowing snow to the west coast and parts of the NW Arctic of Alaska. Easterly wind gusts to 50 to 60 mph will be possible with snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches expected. Blowing snow could reduce visibilities to one half mile or less

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued January 08 at 7:10PM CST by NWS
entry.summary: ...LIGHT FREEZING DRIZZLE EXPECTED BEFORE THE SNOW ARRIVES... Light freezing drizzle has been reported in northeast Wisconsin early this evening, and may expand across much of the region before the steadier snow arrives overnight. The best likelihood of freezing drizzle, and some light icing, is expected over far northeast Wisconsin.
